values:
Note: This is Dr. Clark's actual reaction to my speech.  I have inserted parenthetical comments to emphasize his points and clarify his point of view for what he was trying to say.


(Supreme Invincible Master) Chris,

Thanks for allowing me to look at the text of your speech for Commencement. (As if I'd let you make the speech without my review.)

You have (cleverly) addressed important issues in this speech: the capacity to achieve, the changes that have occurred within (like puberty), the importance of conviction, the need for affiliation.  Thank you.  
However, with the greatest of respect, the platform on Commencement Day is not the place to be funny (you should be hilarious).  To talk about the administration cancelling future commencements, or dirty underwear, or "size", will offend, confuse and embarrass many (RPs) people for whom this ceremony is a dear tradition(al waste of time).  In this setting you are not a journalist trying to get attention and create shock, but a  singular (humor columnist) representative (who was mistakenly elected) of (by) 400 students sitting in front of you (with their chests painted).  You are their mouthpiece, putting into words the things they want to be remembered for.  This is a moment from which lasting memories will emerge, for better or worse (please choose worse).

So, Chris, I kindly ask you to remove those parts of your speech that will (not) detract from the occasion and cause offense.  You have said important things.  Say them well!

I would be happy to discuss this personally if you desire (over a nice cold beer).  Thank you (for the wonderful memories).

For the larger (meaning fatter) Geneva community,

Stanley A. Clark, VPAA

It's funny how much we struggle in America to assert ourselves as individuals. We claim bands as our own, we get angry when people like our movies. Some of the most annoying people to talk to are anal indie-rock/indie-film types who pretend they know every single movie release since sound was added to motion pictures. Liz Phair is a sellout because she is sexy and "Donnie Darko" sucks because you can buy it Columbia House.

You know, we have lost what it really means to be free in America. Free is being able to experience humanity without indie-rock/indie-film ass wipes telling us we can't because they are the "authority" on such matters. They are only speaking out now because they are no longer hassled by jocks. Jocks were such a great countervailing force when it came to the "indies." I miss you jocks.

It is time to rise above the indie-rock/indie-film slave drivers. Listen to the words of Bob Marley, one of the greatest modern musical poets.

"Emancipate yourselves from mental slavery
None but ourselves can free our minds
Have no fear for atomic energy
Cause none of them can stop the time
How long shall they kill our prophets
While we stand aside and look
Some say it's just a part of it
We've got to fulfill the book"
-"Redemption Song" Bob Marley

How would a homeless guy, such as myself, have the opportunity to talk to an intergalactic robot? And why would he have such a desire? After all, I am unclean, unlearned and un-respected. My life is spent digging for trash in dumpsters behind Chinese restaurants/massage parlors. My only company is the voice in my head. Sometimes it calls me by name, encouraging me to scare rich white ladies by looking at them and grinning.

It is warm in the sewer, where I live with my bag of goods and the grungy clothes on my back. In my bag is a block of wood that gives the best advice. I talk to it and it talks back to me. In the morning it reads the horoscopes and at night it reads bedtime stories. I also have my degree from the University of Illinois, which obviously serves me well. Stuck to my degree are a handful of gummy bears. They also talk to me. The company provided by the gummy bears makes each day easier. No one else will talk to me because I stink and my halitosis increases in potency by the day. Gummies don't discriminate.

This is an interview with Sticky Red and Gooey Green. They received their names because they are always stuck to my degree and they make my fingers viscous. 

Homeless Guy: How are you gummies today?

Sticky Red: I'm fine. My meditating session was relaxing this morning. I really felt one with myself and enharmonic with the sewer fumes.

Gooey Green: I'm OK. I didn't sleep well because I had a bad dream about sausages that eat gummy bears.

HG: That's interesting. Did they eat you?

GG: Yes. But I was able to climb my way through their stomachs. I overcame the sausage. It's rare when people overcome sausage. Usually the food they eat gets to them, either causing heart attacks or rapid obesity.

HG: Speaking of food killing you, are either of you on the Atkins diet?

GG: I am. I like to avoid [carbohydrates] and remain physically active. Sometimes I take the stairs at work instead of the elevator. If I become obese, I could always sue the company who makes the foods I eat, despite my unhealthy lifestyle. It's the gummy American way!

SR: Eh, I'm indifferent to diets. I channel my impurities out of my body through meditation and two hours of running and lifting weights. I stand in front of the mirror for hours, primping myself and popping my pimples. Then I spend another few minutes cleaning it all up.

HG: Why the focus on outward appearance?

SR: It's a bad habit I have picked up, ever since a disfiguring accident where I lost half of my head. I do it because I have witnessed many gummy friends die by getting stuck to the soles of human shoes. I do it because I am ashamed of who I am.

HG: Both of you have admitted to being socially conscious. What do you think about same-sex marriages, or in your case, same-gummy marriages?

GG: I don't see the point in gummy animals discussing the issue. We cannot reproduce. We can only be split in half or chewed or melted down or fried or squished or fired from a nostril. I would rather talk about gummy abuse, a more pertinent issue.

HG: Is gummy abuse on the rise or has it declined?

GG: It's declined since Gummy Americans received rights, but it's still an issue. I want to expose it for what it is: a mockery to all of gummy kind.

SR: Yeah, millions of gummies are abused every year and the American government turns a blind eye to it.

HG: Switching subjects, what are your dreams and aspirations?

GG: I am an aspiring writer. Someday I will have my own book. Right now I just have a collection of short stories. In "Hair too Tight" a drag queen talks about getting a weave and in "Unidentified Flying Weaves" a drag queen saves the world from an army of cheesy hair pieces. Donald Trump leads the army of hairpieces. Currently, I am outlining a book about a rare whale and a drag queen's desire to capture it. I feel it's going to be a masterpiece. Since all writers use a pseudonym, mine will be Gummy Funkhouser because everything sounds better German. Take for example, David Hasselhoff. His real name is David Smith, but that is so not ethnic.

SR: I want to be in a rock group. Name of the group will be the Gummy Jam Band. Every member, from the washboard player to the jug tooter, will be a gummy bear or a gummy worm. Working with gummy worms is ground breaking because of the racial strife between both gummy groups. Our music will be groundbreaking, focusing on current social issues, such as a woman's right to vote, the abolition of slavery and gaining independence from Great Britain. We will sound like 80s rock gods, Van Halen, and will have the sex appeal of 80s rock goddesses, The Bengals.

HG: What inspires you?

SR: I am inspired by war, strife and George W. Bush. I support global warming. As a gummy bear, I support outlawing certain drugs, especially those that bring about the munchies. I fear for the lives of my gummy friends, like Gummy Oscar the Octopus and Gummy Joe the T-Rex.

GG: The intricacies of human behavior spark my interest, especially those behaviors that make people want to don clothing. I'm a gummy bear, so I don't wear clothes. I guess I would really like to understand this complex jungle we live in.

A few brief things:

1. Sorry that i haven't updated my journal lately. I'm sure most of you don't care.
2. If you see Fran today, wish her a happy birthday.
3. This January. January falls in Winter. In Winter it snows. That explains all the snow lately
4. I don't like the cold either.

i am back at school. my planes were happy and didn't want to dive into the ground.
in the Satanic Verses, the main characters are in a plane explosion in mid air. they survive by flapping their arms until they hit the ground. that's what i would have done if my plane split in half.

It's here!! My 2003 Super Bowl projections. Representing the AFC will be, I'm sad to say, the NY Jets Oakland Raiders. I really wounldn't mind seeing Pittsburgh, though. For the NFC, it will be the Philadelphia Eagles or Tampon Bay Buccaneers. I kept this ambiguous on purpose.
http://espn.go.com/nfl/playoffs02/s/bracket.html

The halftime show will be wonderful this year with Shania Twain boot scootin'. If you go to Geneva, come to Arms 305's Super Bowl Blow Out!! It will be dandy. The Dixie Chicks will be doing the National Anthem. Eh. Just as long as it's not Avril Lavigne or 'Good' Charlotte. That would be like Usama bin Laden swearing in public officials.

In other news, Fairfax County Police do their own bar crawl.
http://www.washingtonpost.com/wp-dyn/articles/A24635-2003Jan7.html

2002 will always be remembered as the year when i realized i grew. from falling in love with Fran to shifting my homestead, i had to understand that life must change, that life must continue to be dynamic lest it be boring.
and yes it's new year's day and what would the new year be without the talk of change. i predict in 2003 peace will reign with a love-supreme and hatred will return to the bowels of hates from which it originated. my predictions are accompanied by a sense of innocence because i know it's election primping time. for your viewing pleasure i will leave you with a taste of my view in song. enjoy.


All is quiet on New Year's Day.
A world in white gets underway.
I want to be with you, be with you night and day.
Nothing changes on New Year's Day.
On New Year's Day.

I... will be with you again.
I... will be with you again.

Under a blood-red sky
A crowd has gathered in black and white
Arms entwined, the chosen few
The newspaper says, says
Say it's true, it's true...
And we can break through
Though torn in two
We can be one.

I... I will begin again
I... I will begin again.

Oh, oh. Oh, oh. Oh, oh.
Oh, maybe the time is right.
Oh, maybe tonight.
I will be with you again.
I will be with you again.

And so we are told this is the golden age
And gold is the reason for the wars we wage
Though I want to be with you
Be with you night and day
Nothing changes
On New Year's Day
On New Year's Day
On New Year's Day

if you know Sexxy Kate, Horny Misty and/or Dirrty Sara, please tell them to stop sending me emails...


go read 'the satanic verses' by Salman Rushdie..."it's worth death and book burning!!" Honestly, it's a piece of art...it's to Muslim literature as 'dogma' is to the portrayal to the Catholic church...

website of the week: http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/world/middle_east/641898.stm
